UML:UseCase.name: Setting up uStore and developer depot
Signing up as users of uStore and developer depot
Downloading Eclipse tools from Developer Depot
Connecting uStore and Developer Depot together
Changing set of roles for a user

EAScenario.name: 10- Setting up uStore and developer depot
EAScenario.description:
Sauron has observed the aging population of Shire and has identified business opportunities in providing an arena for the exchange of AAL services in Shire. He has hired a group of researchers from another universe (called universAAL) to build software for his market place.
Sauron is told by the universAAL team that one of the major competitive advantages of uStore is that it is closely integrated with something called Developer Depot (DD). This means that developers can be in close contact with users, and can integrate user feedback into new versions of their services.
<u>Open issue</u>: Conceptually, uStore and Developer Depot need to have different operator roles. Here Sauron will either takes on both of the roles or we introduce a new character as DD operator. Two separate scenarios are created for setting up uStore and DD.
The following 1X scenarios show how each of uStore and DD are set up.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_B6C6CF48_E9E8_4d65_BB9E_812AD3C89A3D

EAScenario.name: 11- Setting up uStore
EAScenario.description:
Sauron has observed the aging population of Shire and has identified business opportunities in providing an arena for the exchange of AAL services in Shire. He has hired a group of researchers from another universe (called universAAL) to build software for his market place.
Sauron is told by the universAAL team that one of the major competitive advantages of uStore is that it is closely integrated with something called Developer Depot (DD). This means that developers can be in close contact with users, and can integrate user feedback into new versions of their services.
<u>Open issue</u>: Conceptually, uStore and Developer Depot need to have different operator roles. Here Sauron will either takes on both of the roles or we introduce a new character as DD operator. Two separate scenarios are created for setting up uStore and DD.
The following 1X scenarios show how each of uStore and DD are set up.
EAScenario.subject: EAPK_B6C6CF48_E9E8_4d65_BB9E_812AD3C89A3D

EAScenario.name: Adding new sevices to uStore
EAScenario.description:
Gandalf registers to uStore
uStore has conformance testing for new applications that are uploaded. Compliance with uAAL
Tools in eclipse need to interface to both depot and ustore
- Gandalf registers as user of uStore, possibly clicks for "I am a developer" - Forwarded to developer depot
- One or few depots, while one ustore for each market. Relations between these two needs to be identified. - Where are user profiles of Gandalf stored?
- Confirm email is sent to Gandalf. - Link to eclipse feature set for uAAL is provided (email or on web page). - Link to other more basic methods (in case the developer is not interested in our tools. Note: This step has low priority) - Links are provided to 1) eclipse web site (if the developer does not have eclipse installed), and 2) link to uAAL eclipse update site. - Install uAAL studio where Gandalf is asked for which features to install + restart. - This means a set of features: 1) Dev depot client, 2) uStore client, 3) modelling support, 4) Process support dashboard, 5) a set of wizards for each feature, 6) personalization support, 7) build support. - Each feature has a help button to show what each feature is and why it is needed (or not needed) - Gandalf checks all features and installs them. - Gandalf restarts eclipse. -
Open issues: automatic upload from DD to uStore? sending nightly builds upon request?
EAScenario.subject: EAID_14EBC2D9_4C46_4b94_8A7C_CE8DCD46379A

EAScenario.name: Reimbursement of service costs
EAScenario.description:
Actors: Denethor, Bilbo, Aragorn keywords, ideas: - Denethor pays Bilbo directly - Denethor pays Aragorn - Reimbursable services section in uStore? Questions: - How is payment for services done? subscription, per use, pre-paid. - How is reimbursement done?
  • No reimbursement: Bilbo gets the bill and pays.
  • Post-reimbursement: Bilbo gets bill from uStore, manually sends bill to Denethor and gets money back.
  • Automatic reimbursement: Bilbo is registered as beneficiary of Denethor
  • Integration with legacy billing systems. Will uStore provide some form of reporting/auditing of service usage that can be exported to a billing system?
Need a decision on level of reimbursement support..
EAScenario.subject: EAID_28197095_7AD6_446c_B5CD_F17333C60AC2

EAScenario.name: Setting up uStore and developer depot
EAScenario.description: Actors: Sauron Sauron has observed the aging population of Shire and has identified business opportunities in providing an arena for the exchange of AAL services in Shire. He has hired a group of researchers from another universe (called universAAL) to build software for his market place. Sauron is told by the universAAL team that one of the major competitive advantages of uStore is that it is closely integrated with something called Developer Depot (DD). This means that developers can be in close contact with users, and can integrate user feedback into new versions of their services. Open issue: Conceptually, uStore and Developer Depot need to have different operator roles. Here Sauron will either takes on both of the roles or we introduce a new character as DD operator. Two separate scenarios are created for setting up uStore and DD. The following 1X scenarios show how each of uStore and DD are set up.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_443434D1_DDE2_4704_ACFC_9B5D6716E0BB

EAScenario.name: Signing up as users of uStore and developer depot
EAScenario.description: The following 2X scenarios describe how registration process is done and who is involved.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_4E266182_CDA9_4b18_8A1B_9F14588268D8

EAScenario.name: Downloading Eclipse tools from Developer Depot
EAScenario.description:
Actor: Gandalf On the DD portal page there is a link to development tools. Gandalf clicks on this link and a new page showing a list of links shows up.
  • Option 1: Gandalf has Eclipse installed. He can click on a link and download uAAL features from the web page to his hard disk.
  • Option 2: Gandalf gets a link to uAAL update site for Eclipse, opens Eclipse and adds this to Eclipse update sites. Then he searches for universAAL and finds the features that are then installed.
  • Option 3: Gandalf does not have Eclipse installed. He downloads a uAAL distribution of Eclipse from the site.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_67BE15F3_54BA_4df4_A64A_D7BF2D0BD61D

EAScenario.name: Setting up Developer Depot
EAScenario.description: Actors: Sauron, or someone else (a DD operator). - Will we distinguish between Sauron and a developer depot operator? E.g. Apple runs AppStore but many of the applications in AppStore are developed on Sourceforge. - Many of the same questions asked in Setting up uStore apply also here.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_7A69360A_E1B6_4b0c_836D_1CB68CE76E6D

EAScenario.name: Setting up uStore
EAScenario.description: Actors: Sauron This scenarios should describe what Sauron does in order to set up a uStore. - Does he have to download uStore software from a server and install it? Idea: Why not have uStore software downloaded from DD? The idea is to have a place to be able to download uStore software for Sauron to start. - Does he buy a uStore service from a meta-operator, a uStore hotel? Idea: Developer Depot could provide this service? - Does he need to get approval from The Witch king of Angmar? - How does he connect to Denethor? Denethor is interesting in tracking service usage in order to know what to reimburse. See reimbursement use case. - How does he install the software? What basic infrastructure does he need? - How does he connect to Developer Depot? - Will uStore have any marketing facilities? Towards Bilbo, Frodo, Gandalf, etc.?
EAScenario.subject: EAID_7C5C34CF_5BD2_48b3_A61A_BF78C29EB8DD

EAScenario.name: Connecting uStore and Developer Depot together
EAScenario.description:
Actors: uStore and DD operators (Sauron and Sauron?) Open issue: We need to be clear about the value in connecting DD and uStore.
  • We have discussed at least one topic which is allowing developers collect feedback from users, but this can also be a mechanism that allows downloaded code talk directly to DD. No uStore needed in between. Anna: The idea is that other uStore users can also see the feedback!
  • Another value is that if Gandalf registers to DD he has the option of automatically registering to uStore in a developer role. But this is also something that can be done in the Eclipse tools and does not need to involve DD. Maybe Gandalf wants to store some feedback in DD because it is related directly to the code.
  • Anna: Providing the latest build of a software upon a uStore user request.
We need to specify how the two are connected. In a real life scenario we should distinguish between a uStore operator and a DD operator. See the open issue below. Open issue: Will the connections be 1-1 og N-N? Can a uStore be connected to many DDs and vice versa? In my (Babak's) opinion yes. Gandalf wants to use one DD for development but many uStores for uploading his code. Sauron wants to operate one uStore but possibly allow integration with many DDs. A programmer like Gandalf will most probably register to one DD, while he might register to many uStores for selling his code.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_7D7A222F_3F38_4834_AC46_B7194036F765

EAScenario.name: Changing set of roles for a user
EAScenario.description:
Actor: Any uStore user
- Option for selecting one or more roles such as elderly, next of kin, developer, service provider. - Option for changing roles or taking on new roles any time
EAScenario.subject: EAID_9D1A22AD_B0D6_4bcf_A7B2_8D142B221CD1

EAScenario.name: Signing up to Developer Depot
EAScenario.description:
Actors: Gandalf and possibly Saruman (Saruman if we want to support company visibility in DD in addition to supporting freelance programmers). Sauron or DD operator needs to approve. Gandalf goes to DD and selects register user Gandalf fills inn information about himself Gandalf fills in information about WizSoft Ltd. Open issue: Do we need an institutional user here? In general there might be a need to have some entity in uStore and DD with legal responsibility. In this case if someone wants to sue someone because a service does not work then they have some legal entity to sue. This can be done by some group option (e.g. all those working for Trondheim municipality) or a more generic relationship function that can be specialized (e.g. employer of, family member of, caretaker of...) Please review the following. Relates to number 17 above. Gandalf fills in information about which uStores he will use to upload his code. A list of registered uStores is provided for selection. Gandalf can also add his own uStores. Gandalf does not have user on any uStore so DD registration process asks whether a user should be created in the selected uStores. A user is automatically created for Gandalf in all those uStores where Gandalf is not registered. After registration Gandalf receives a confirmation email and confirms Idea: We need to have some form of identity management here, e.g. using open ID. Open issue: Should we have some central approval option for the DD operator? Open issue: What role will Gandalf have in the uStores he selects in the list above? Maybe a service provider role? The opening page of DD after registration is finished should show:
  • Some links to help sections
  • Link to Eclipse tools from WP3 to download. Possibly a link to a packaged Eclipse distribution.
  • Link to projects that Gandalf has created (currently none).
  • Overview of messages from e.g. users, service providers, other developers...
  • Link to uStores Gandalf is registered at.
EAScenario.subject: EAID_BCA86C32_56AB_47e4_A481_869DF7BB85A6

EAScenario.name: Signing up to uStore
EAScenario.description:
Actors: Bilbo (is the elderly), Frodo (is the next of kin), Gandalf (wants to upload code and get user feedback on his code), Aragorn (wants to provide services), Legalos (wants to help Bilbo), Denethor (wants to pay for reimbursable services), The king (wants to monitor) Open issue: We have discussed the process of signing up and there are two main alternatives coming up related to the role:
  1. A user specifies role before registration.
    1. Advantage: possibly simpler implementation of uStore.
    2. Disadvantages: users with multiple roles need to register multiple times.
  1. A user specifies role after registration, in a list where he/she clicks for the roles he/she wants to play
    1. Advantages: flexible, users can take on different or multiple roles that can change over time.
    2. Disadvantages: ??
Refer to use case changing set of roles for a user. To be added: We need to specify how each of the roles above can be registered, i.e. how an elderly, a next of kin, a service provider, a programmer can register. Service provider: Aragorn has heard about uAAL and the new uStore through the local orcs. He contacts Sauron who advises him to register to uStore and indicate he is a major service provider in Shire. Aragorn goes to the uStore web site and registered. Checks for service provider, with 1000+ working for him. He also registers Shire municipality as the legal entity providing the services. Aragorn asks Legolas to register as service provider and select "Employee of Shire municipality".
EAScenario.subject: EAID_D483997E_4288_4919_A11D_38D16B327157
